Package cp213

Class SingleQueue<T>

java.lang.Object
cp213.SingleLink<T>
cp213.SingleQueue<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the SingleQueue data type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<T>
public class SingleQueue<T>
extends SingleLink<T>
A simple linked queue structure of Node T objects. Only the T data contained in the queue is visible through the standard queue methods. Extends the SingleLink class, which already defines the head node, length, peek, isEmpty, and iterator.
Version:
2020-10-16
Author:
your name here, David Brown

  • Constructor Details

    • SingleQueue

      public SingleQueue()

  • Method Details

    • combine

      public void combine​(SingleQueue<T> left, SingleQueue<T> right)
      Combines the contents of the left and right SingleQueues into the current SingleQueue. Moves nodes only - does not move data or call the high-level methods insert or remove. left and right SingleQueues are empty when done. Nodes are moved alternately from left and right to this SingleQueue. You have two queues called left and right queues. You remove nodes from these two queues to create a new queue (current queue). If the current queue is empty or not, it should not make a difference to you. you just get nodes from the right and left queues and add them to the current queue. Do not use insert and remove methods. …. Use moveFront method included in the class. Remember to remove a node from the list you have to update the reference or the pointer that is pointing to the current node. The getNext () and setNext() methods from SingleNode class can be used for these purpose. Do not assume that both right and left queues are of the same length.
      Parameters:
      left - The first SingleQueue to extract nodes from.
      right - The second SingleQueue to extract nodes from.

    • insert

      public void insert​(T data)
      Adds data to the rear of the queue. Increments the queue length.
      Parameters:
      data - The data to added to the rear of the queue.

    • remove

      public T remove()
      Returns the front data of the queue and removes that data from the queue. The next node in the queue becomes the new first node. Decrements the queue length.
      Returns:
      The data at the front of the queue.

    • split

      public void split​(SingleQueue<T> left, SingleQueue<T> right)
      Splits the contents of the current SingleQueue into the left and right SingleQueues. Moves nodes only - does not move data or call the high-level methods insert or remove. this SingleQueue is empty when done. Nodes are moved alternately from this SingleQueue to left and right. This is the opposite of the combine method.
      Parameters:
      left - The first SingleQueue to move nodes to.
      right - The second SingleQueue to move nodes to.
